required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Non-inferiority, Comparative Study Between Foraseq®, Eurofarma´s Formoterol/Budesonide and Alenia® in Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Non-inferiority, Open-label, Comparative Study Between Foraseq® Inhalation Capsules, Eurofarma's Single Formoterol / Budesonide Inhalation Capsule and Single Alenia® Inhalation Capsule in Asthmatic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective will be to compare the Eurofarma and Alenia formulations regarding their impact on the pulmonary function of mild to moderate persistent asthma patients and the secondary objective will be to compare the three study formulations regarding the clinical control of the symptoms and the patients' compliance to the treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) at the final visit (FV)

secondary_outcome.measure: asthma control score in the Asthma Control Questionnaire-7 (ACQ-7)

arm_group.description: formoterol and budesonide will be administered at the 12/400 µg dosage, twice a day for 12 weeks.
Foraseq will be administered at the 12/400 µg dosage, twice a da for 12 weeks.
Alenia will be administered at the 12/400 µg dosage, twice a da for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: formoterol and budesonide will be administered at the 12/400 µg dosage, twice a da for 12 weeks.
foraseq will be administered at the 12/400 µg dosage, twice a da for 12 weeks.
Alenia will be administered at the 12/400 µg dosage, twice a da for 12 weeks.

facility.name: Centro de Referencia em Enfermidades Respiratoria e Alergica
IMA Brasil - Instituto de Pesquisa Clínica e Medicina Avançada
